statement_context: a speech at the Republican convention
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Hillary Clinton wants to increase number of Syrian refugees by 500 percent
statement: Says "Hillary (Clinton) wants to increase the number (of Syrian refugees) by 500 percent."

ruling_link_text: Many hold a favorable view of ISIS
statement_context: a speech at the Republican National Convention
ruling_headline: Gingrich: 9% of Pakistanis support ISIS
statement: "Just 9 percent of Muslims in Pakistan support ISIS. Unfortunately, that 9 percent is 16 million people. And that’s just one country."

ruling_link_text: The number is right, but the shutdowns weren't equivalent
statement_context: a comment on CNN's "Crossfire"
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says shutdowns are 'normal' process, with 12 under Tip O’Neill and two under Gingrich
statement: Shutdowns are "a normal part of the constitutional process," with 12 shutdowns under Democratic House Speaker Tip O’Neill and two during his own speakership.

ruling_link_text: Yes, but majority favors most elements of reform
statement_context: on CNN's "Crossfire"
ruling_headline: Obamacare "has never been favored by a majority of Americans," Gingrich says
statement: "(Obamacare) is a bill which has never once had a majority of Americans favor it."

ruling_link_text: UPDATED: O'Malley and Gingrich fight to a draw in statistical faceoff
statement_context: a discussion on CNN's "Crossfire"
ruling_headline: Martin O'Malley, Newt Gingrich face off over population statistics on "Crossfire"
statement: Since 2007, "Texas has gained 440,000 people" while "Maryland has lost 20,000."

ruling_link_text: He cites FBI data, but it's a rough estimate
statement_context: a roundtable discussion on CNN's "State of the Union"
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says gangs have increased by 40 percent since Barack Obama was elected
statement: "Gangs have increased by 40 percent since this president was elected."

ruling_link_text: Statistically insignificant rise was a departure from past three years
statement_context: a discussion on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says rise in unemployment statistic shows weakness of labor market
statement: The labor market is weak because if you count the unemployed, underemployed, and those who’ve stopped looking for work,  the unemployment rate "actually went up last month to 13.5 percent."

ruling_link_text: Chu wanted a gradual price hike
statement_context: an appearance on "Fox News Sunday"
ruling_headline: Gingrich said energy secretary advocated raising gas prices
statement: Obama's secretary of energy, Dr. Steven Chu, "has said publicly he wants us to pay European levels (for gasoline), and that would be $9 or $10 a gallon."

ruling_link_text: Chu wanted a gradual price hike
statement_context: an appearance on "Fox News Sunday"
ruling_headline: Gingrich said energy secretary advocated raising gas prices
statement: Obama's secretary of energy, Dr. Steven Chu, "has said publicly he wants us to pay European levels (for gasoline), and that would be $9 or $10 a gallon."

ruling_link_text: Past support is on record
statement_context: a campaign ad
ruling_headline: Pro-Santorum super PAC ad says Gingrich supported individual mandates
statement: "Gingrich supported individual health insurance mandates."

ruling_link_text: Not an apples-to-apples comparison
statement_context: a televised address
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says U.S. may have 'three times as much oil' as Saudi Arabia
statement: One estimate says there may be "three times as much oil in the United States as there is in Saudi Arabia."

ruling_link_text: According to a now-outdated study
statement_context: an interview on "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says EPA plans to boost gas prices 25 cents per gallon
statement: Says President Barack Obama "has an Environmental Protection Agency proposal that would raise the price of gasoline by 25 cents a gallon."

ruling_link_text: UPDATED: A fine by any other name....
statement_context: a television ad
ruling_headline: Did Newt Gingrich pay a $300,000 ethics fine back in the 1990s?
statement: Newt Gingrich "was fined $300,000 for ethics violations."

ruling_link_text: Nursing home residents kept kosher
statement_context: a speech in Tampa, Fla.
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Mitt Romney cut off Jewish nursing home residents' kosher food
statement: "Gov. Romney cut off kosher meals for Jewish senior citizens who were on Medicaid to save $5 a day."

ruling_link_text: Rule he's speaking of has religious exemption
statement_context: a town hall in Jacksonville, Fla.
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says government would impose 'Obamacare' standards on religious institutions
statement: "The Obama administration ... would impose on every Catholic institution, every Jewish institution, every Protestant institution the Obamacare standard of what you have to buy as insurance."

ruling_link_text: Actually, four-year completion rates have risen steadily in recent years
statement_context: comments at a campaign event
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says students today 'take more years to get through' college
statement: Students today "take more years to get through" college.

ruling_link_text: Much better phrased than previous versions
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Jacksonville, Fla.
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich revises claim on balanced budgets, improves Truth-O-Meter rating
statement: "We balanced the budget with the 1997 Balanced Budget Act, and ultimately had four consecutive balanced budgets."

ruling_link_text: Voted to create it, didn't recently want to get rid of it
statement_context: comments to reporters in Tampa, Fla.
ruling_headline: Mitt Romney says Newt Gingrich wanted Education Department, then didn't
statement: "(Newt Gingrich) voted in favor of establishing the Department of Education, and yet he gets in a debate and says we should get rid of the Department of Education and send all the education issues back to the states."

ruling_link_text: Freddie's a GSE, credit union's not
statement_context: a Republican presidential primary debate
ruling_headline: Gingrich repeats claim that Freddie Mac, credit unions are ‘government-sponsored enterprises’
statement: Newt Gingrich says electric co-ops and credit unions are "government-sponsored enterprises" like Freddie Mac.

ruling_link_text: Two during his tenure, two after he was gone
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Tampa
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich repeats claim that he balanced the federal budget four times as speaker
statement: "When I was speaker, we had four consecutive balanced budgets."

ruling_link_text: Board has no say in abortion
statement_context: a video campaign ad
ruling_headline: Gingrich ad says Mitt Romney appointed Planned Parenthood to a medical board but not an anti-abortion group
statement: Says Mitt Romney "put Planned Parenthood on a state medical board but failed to put a pro-life group on the same board."

ruling_link_text: It wasn't in the law
statement_context: a video ad
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich ad says Mitt Romney enacted taxpayer-funded abortions
statement: "Romney signed government-mandated health care with taxpayer-funded abortions."

ruling_link_text: Record numbers, but wrong to focus blame on Obama
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Myrtle Beach, S.C.
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Obama put more people on food stamps than any other U.S. President
statement: "More people have been put on food stamps by Barack Obama than any president in American history."

ruling_link_text: Not anytime recently
statement_context: a campaign ad
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich ad says Mitt Romney 'runs away from Ronald Reagan'
statement: Says Mitt Romney "runs away from Ronald Reagan."

ruling_link_text: Listed, not cited, but not clear why
statement_context: an NBC-Facebook debate in Concord, N.H.
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says that EPA didn't know why it cited a New Hampshire dump
statement: The EPA was asked about an environmental citation for the city landfill in Nashua, N.H. but "didn’t know" why it was cited.

ruling_link_text: Yes, if Bush tax cuts are extended
statement_context: a conference call by a campaign spokesman with New Hampshire reporters.
ruling_headline: Obama campaign says half of the benefit from Newt Gingrich's tax plan goes to top 1 percent
statement: "Fifty percent of Speaker Gingrich’s tax plan goes to the top 1 percent."

ruling_link_text: A misleading portrayal
statement_context: a video ad
ruling_headline: Ad claims Newt Gingrich favored federal funding for some abortions
statement: "As speaker, Gingrich even supported taxpayer funding of some abortions."

ruling_link_text: Big Brother doesn't nix Father Christmas
statement_context: a campaign event in Davenport, Iowa
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says no federal official is allowed to say "Merry Christmas"
statement: "No federal official at any level is currently allowed to say ‘Merry Christmas.’"

ruling_link_text: There's video evidence
statement_context: a video ad
ruling_headline: Attack ad says Newt Gingrich aligned with Dems on global warming
statement: Newt Gingrich "teamed with Nancy Pelosi and Al Gore on global warming."

ruling_link_text: Ignores long line of precedents and details of case in question
statement_context: an interview on CBS' "Face the Nation"
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Supreme Court crossed major threshold with 1958 case
statement: In a watershed 1958 decision, "the Warren court asserted by itself that the Supreme Court was supreme over the president and the Congress."

ruling_link_text: No. Not really
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Sioux City, Iowa
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Freddie Mac, electric co-ops and credit unions are similar organizations
statement: Says Freddie Mac, electric co-ops and credit unions are all "government sponsored" enterprises.

ruling_link_text: True, with one caveat
statement_context: a Republican presidential primary debate
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann claims Newt Gingrich promised support for abortion proponents
statement: Says Newt Gingrich "made an affirmative statement that he would not only support but he would campaign for Republicans who were in support of the barbaric procedure known as partial-birth abortion."

ruling_link_text: When a lobbyist isn't a lobbyist
statement_context: a debate in Iowa
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich said he never lobbied for Freddie Mac 'under any circumstance'
statement: "I never lobbied under any circumstance" for Freddie Mac.

ruling_link_text: Wrong then, wrong now
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Sioux City, Iowa
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich repeats claim about his record of balancing budget, reducing debt
statement: "I balanced the budget for four straight years, paid off $405 billion in debt."

ruling_link_text: Uh, except for that Pants on Fire...
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Sioux City, Iowa
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says "PolitiFact came out and said that everything I said was true" in last debate
statement: "After the debate that we had last week, PolitiFact came out and said that everything I said was true."

ruling_link_text: Sensitivity, not bans
statement_context: a foreign policy debate with Jon Huntsman in Manchester, N.H., Dec. 12, 2011
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says the Obama administration instructed terrorism training to not mention Islam
statement: "The Obama administration just issued instructions that terrorism training should not involve any reference to Islam."

ruling_link_text: Loosen law? Yes. Get rid of it? No.
statement_context: an interview on Fox News
ruling_headline: Romney: Gingrich wants to scrap child labor laws
statement: "Speaker Gingrich has said that we ought to get rid of our child labor laws."

ruling_link_text: The difference between custodial engineers and janitors
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Des Moines, Iowa
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says that in New York City, starting janitor is paid twice as much as a starting teacher
statement: In New York City, "an entry level janitor gets paid twice as much as an entry level teacher."

ruling_link_text: In the mid 1980s, Gingrich revived an idea from 1920s space pioneers
statement_context: a column in the New York Times
ruling_headline: David Brooks says Newt Gingrich once proposed putting mirrors in space
statement: Newt Gingrich "has suggested" building "a mirror system in space" could improve the Earth’s habitability.

ruling_link_text: A requirement to purchase -- or post a bond
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Des Moines, Iowa
ruling_headline: Michele Bachmann says Newt Gingrich backed individual mandate in 1993, 2011
statement: In 1993, Newt Gingrich "first advocated for the individual mandate in health care. And as recently as May of this year, he was still advocating" for it.

ruling_link_text: A historian rewrites history
statement_context: an interview with Fox News' Greta Van Susteren
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich blasts 1990s ethics investigation of him, calling it partisan
statement: Says the congressional ethics investigation against him was conducted by "a very partisan political committee" in a way that "related more to the politics of the Democratic Party than to ethics."

ruling_link_text: Except when he did favor it
statement_context: a Republican presidential candidate forum
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich claims he 'never favored cap and trade'
statement: "I never favored cap and trade."

ruling_link_text: Gingrich overplays an otherwise fair point
statement_context: a press conference
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says unemployment only dropped because of people who stopped looking for work
statement: "The only reason the unemployment rate is going down is because … twice as many people dropped out of the employment pool as the number of jobs were created."

ruling_link_text: Two sectors that have actually done pretty well under Obama
statement_context: a press conference
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Barack Obama has killed jobs in energy, manufacturing
statement: President Barack Obama "has now spent three years proving that he kills jobs in energy, he kills jobs in manufacturing."

ruling_link_text: First a fighter, then a deal-maker
statement_context: an interview on NBC's "The Daily Rundown"
ruling_headline: David Axelrod calls Newt Gingrich 'the godfather of gridlock'
statement: Says Newt Gingrich is responsible for the gridlocked politics of Washington.

ruling_link_text: If amnesty means a path to legalization
statement_context: a press conference
ruling_headline: Does Newt Gingrich support amnesty? Mitt Romney says his plan goes there
statement: Newt Gingrich’s immigration plan offers "a new doorway to amnesty."

ruling_link_text: Wrong in so many ways
statement_context: a speech in Council Bluffs, Iowa
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says you can use food stamps to get to Hawaii
statement: People can use food stamps "for anything," including "to go to Hawaii," and even millionaires can qualify.

ruling_link_text: UPDATED: The number's on target, but incorrectly described
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Washington, D.C.
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Chile has 72 percent national savings rate
statement: In Chile "they have 72 percent of the GDP in savings."

ruling_link_text: They're actually doing better
statement_context: remarks at Mandester, N.H. campaign headquarters
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Dodd-Frank is destroying community banks
statement: "Community banks … are being destroyed by Dodd-Frank."

ruling_link_text: Yes, using one definition of "administrator"
statement_context: a Republican presidential debate in Michigan
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says by 2014, there will be one administrator for every teacher on college campuses
statement: "By 2014, there will be one administrator for every teacher on college campuses in the United States."

ruling_link_text: It's the second highest in four decades, at least
statement_context: a written opening statement for a debate
ruling_headline: Gingrich says more Americans in poverty than at any time since the statistic was first calculated
statement: Under President Barack Obama, "more Americans are in poverty ... than at any time since the Census Bureau began keeping records on it over 50 years ago."

ruling_link_text: No such requirement
statement_context: at a meeting arranged by the Small Business Caucus at the Kimball Jenkins House in Concord, N.H.
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says Dodd-Frank law requires 20 percent down payments
statement: Says the new Dodd-Frank financial law requires a 20 percent down payment to buy a house.

ruling_link_text: UPDATE: Census numbers aren't clear cut
statement_context: in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich says a "large number" of the uninsured make more than $75,000
statement: "A large number of the uninsured earn $75,000 or more a year."

ruling_link_text: The meter turns full circle
statement_context: comments in various media outlets
ruling_headline: Did Newt Gingrich flip-flop on supporting Paul Ryan's budget?
statement: On supporting the budget proposed by Rep. Paul Ryan

ruling_link_text: Food stamp use at record high, but not exclusively Obama's fault
statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich defends calling Barack Obama "food stamp president"
statement: President Barack Obama deserves to be called "the most successful food stamp president in American history" because "47 million Americans are on food stamps."

ruling_link_text: Only part of these achievements on his watch
statement_context: a presidential campaign announcement video
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich inaccurate in budget, debt claims in video announcement
statement: "For four years, we balanced the budget and paid off $405 billion in debt."

ruling_link_text: Unemployment fell -- but not that far
statement_context: a campaign video
ruling_headline: Gingrich unemployment rate claim off target
statement: During his time as House speaker, "unemployment came down from 5.6 percent to under 4 (percent)."

ruling_link_text: Facebook explanation doesn't exactly fly
statement_context: televised interviews
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich accused of flip-flopping on Libyan no-fly zone
statement: On whether the United States should intervene in Libya.

ruling_link_text: Sharper wording would have made it correct
statement_context: an interview on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour"
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich accuses Obama administration of cutting democracy funds for Egypt
statement: The Obama administration "actually cut out the democracy in Egypt funds inside the State Department."

ruling_link_text: Actually, a few million such households did
statement_context: a speech to the Southern Republican Leadership Conference
ruling_headline: Gingrich says that only millionaires paid first U.S. income tax
statement: When the United States "first created the federal income tax, frankly, nobody below a million dollars a year paid anything."

ruling_link_text: Interpol just doesn't work that way
statement_context: an interview on 'The O'Reilly Factor'
ruling_headline: Gingrich claims Obama's order will let Interpol investigate American officials
statement: A recent Obama executive order could "lead to a number of investigations by Interpol in the United States, potentially aimed at American officials."

ruling_link_text: Seven months in, Obama lags
statement_context: an op-ed in The Washington Post
ruling_headline: Barack Obama poll after seven months shows him behind other presidents
statement: "Since World War II, only Gerald Ford and Bill Clinton have had worse ratings after seven months than President Obama."

ruling_link_text: Newt's right: Democrats don't want to give up their health care plans
statement_context: an interview with This Week.
ruling_headline: Most Democrats are opposed to giving up their health care plans
statement: In every committee when the health care bill was considered, Democrats voted against an amendment that would require members of Congress and their staff to take the government-run public option as their health care plan.

ruling_link_text: Sunday schools may proceed as usual
statement_context: an e-mail
ruling_headline: Stimulus bill won't change status of Sunday school
statement: Inside the stimulus package "is anti-Christian legislation that will stop churches from using public schools for meeting on Sundays, as well as Boy Scouts and student Bible study groups."

ruling_link_text: Newt wishes he hadn't called Sotomayor 'racist'
statement_context: a statement on the Human Events Web site
ruling_headline: Gingrich reverses on calling Sotomayor a racist
statement: On calling Supreme Court nominee Sonia Sotomayor a racist.

ruling_link_text: Bush vetoed the law Dems passed
statement_context: a television interview
ruling_headline: Gingrich wrong on Democrats and waterboarding
statement: Democrats in Congress "had control since January of 2007. They haven't passed a law making waterboarding illegal. They haven't gone into any of these things and changed law."

ruling_link_text: More a Half Flip than "bitterest hypocrisy"
statement_context: a news interview
ruling_headline: Gingrich has moderated tone on torture
statement: On torture.

ruling_link_text: Turns out Gingrich went after Bush too
statement_context: an appearance on MSNBC.
ruling_headline: O'Donnell alleges Gingrich laid off Bush, record indicates otherwise
statement: "There are no similar clips of Newt Gingrich talking about how ineffective President Bush was in trying to control North Korea."
